name: BatchBlue Software
overview:
BatchBlue was created with one goal in mind: to create useful, user-friendly software for small businesses. The software is especially designed for businesses that have:

  • a limited budget or IT staff.
  • to track contact information about their customers and any points of contact that the business has with a customer (phone calls, e-mails, purchases, returns, reservations, etc.).
  • a need to collect industry and business specific information about their customers that canâ€™t be handled by basic e-mail management software.
  • the desire for an easy-to-use system with excellent customer support.

The founders of BatchBlue come from a variety of programming, project management, and Web usability backgrounds, but they share a passion for technology and a commitment to making it useful and accessible for customers.

BatchBlue’s flagship product, BatchBook, is a social CRM that allows you to keep track of your business, personal, and social networking contacts and share them with the rest of your team. You can create a flexible, easy-to-use contact database from scratch, or import your contacts from an existing system.

BatchBlue Software is also the founder of #SBBUZZ, a weekly Twitter chat about small business and technology, and a founding member of the Small Business Web (thesmallbusinessweb.com), which is a Directory of web applications for small businesses.
